intro: Decaschistia cuddapahensis, commonly known as the Cuddapah rock fig, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the Cuddapah Basin of southern India. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and related plants, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a leathery texture, while its fruits are small and clustered. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
